reviews.review:
I thought Portal was good but Portal 2 is just over the top... the story line, the voice acting, the puzzles, the new gadgets,   the graphics.... everything is great and just crazy addictive.

The Custom map maker was unexpected and a nice surprise as well.... looking forward to checking out everyone's work.

Mt bom msm, história boa d+ e personagens engraçados, testes bem criativos(mais difíceis que o de Portal 1), ambiente legal. Recomendo muito, melhorou bastante em comparação ao primeiro, que já era ótimo.
se jeu est trop bien je vousle conseille Vraiment

这游戏可以排入我所有玩过的游戏里最喜欢的前三。一周目单人在2016年通关，双人在2017年通关。最近和一个没玩过双人的朋友一起把全成就做完了。
这游戏继超级马里奥银河和塞尔达传说黄昏公主后，再次刷新了我对游戏的认知。游戏中充满着丰富的想象力，超神的关卡设计和富有挑战性的谜题设置。对玩家的发散思维，想象力和空间思维能力是一次全新的挑战，双人模式同时也会考验两个人的默契和合作能力。
感谢一起玩双人合作模式的三个朋友。至此单人一周目，双人二周目，总用时37小时，全成就达成，完美收官～

Very good game should definitely play this game.
-★★★★★★★★☆☆ , 8/10
Si el original era una obra maestra, este es una obra maestra elevada a la enesima  potencia. Un juegazo, excesivamente recomendable. 10/10

Наилучшая игра в мире! Такого сюжета вы нигде не видели! Игра-головоломка не для всех, но все равно вы будете наслаждаться каждой минутой прохождения этой игры! А если и сюжета вам не хватило, то для вас есть редактор! В редакторе вы сами можете создать уровень для своих друзей, или для других. А кооперотив то какой.
Ну вообщем игра крутая!

Обожаю серии игр, где есть вопросы, на которые игра не отвечает. Приходится самим делать догадки и после этого играть уже в наполовину созданном для тебя сюжете. Это очень круто). Различные модификации позволяют лишь расширять полноценную историю. Графика заставляет останавливаться в некоторых местах и наблюдать за зрелищностью увиденного. Физика тоже на высшем уровне. Отталкивающий гель и ускоряющий гель (а так же тот, который позволяет делать порталы на неправильных поверхностях) делают своё дело. В общем очередной ШЕДЕВАР от компании Valve. 10 порталов на Луне из 10.

[h1] Now YOU'RE Thinking With Portals, Too! (It's Still Not An Original Joke) [/h1]
[b] Note: This is a rereview, redone in my "new style" of review. [/b]

[b] tl;dr: Now it's a jumbo but left out for a while marshmallow: fluffier, tastier, more fun, and more to it, but it also feels kind of dry, as if something was lost by having it sit outside for a bit. Still tasty, but it leaves one to wonder... [/b]

Portal 2 is Valve's second puzzle game, but not just any puzzle game, as it sees you in the ruins of a testing facility in first person view and soon after picking up a gun... that shoots portals. All the while being talked to by a British robot sphere dude that is kind of a [strike] lovely baka that you should love~<3 [/strike] "maron" (won't spell it right because Steam censors harsh words, which is good) that very much enjoys casual and light conversation, jokes, and [spoiler] becoming mad with power. [/spoiler] As you progress through the game, you also get to learn more about the history of the facility and you even get to meet up with an old [spoiler] muderous [/spoiler] friend!

[u] General Overview [/u]
As stated, this is a puzzle game. Each room consists of a puzzle, with each puzzle getting progressively difficult. You start off with just your hands, then a one-way portal device, and finally a dual portal device. There is also a co-op mode, which can be played before or after campaign mode (though the story in co-op is a continuation of the story in campaign, so it is best to beat the campaign first), as well as the ability to test your hand at building your own puzzles to share with the world, or try some community made puzzles using the Steam Workshop feature of this game! What fun!

[u] Pros [/u]
[b] MORE. MORE EVERYWHERE. [/b]
- More music and ambiance
- More campaign
- More comedy
- More achievments
- More post-game in the form of co-op
- Infinite post-game in the form of community made puzzles
[b] *More ends here* [/b]
- A deeper storyline and deeper lore
- In co-op, customization in the form of cosmetics for your robots

[u] Cons [/u]
- The co-op customization loadout screen is nearly always broken
- The only way to get cosmetics beyond the unlockable ones (which there is not many of) is by purchasing them
- From what I can remember, there is no in-game chat in co-op

[u] Nitpicks (That May Detract From Your Overall Enjoyment) [/u]
- Some cosmetics are unlocked by owning the hat in Team Fortress 2. This wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't for the fact that nearly all the hats you can unlock in Portal 2 by Team Fortress 2 hats can only be obtained by purchasing them on the Steam Market, or trading for them. Luckily, they aren't that rare, which makes this only a nitpick
- Co-op is exclusively with friends. There is no matchmaking or anything, and your friend must own Portal 2 as well

[b] Conclusion [/b]
Valve made a pretty interesting game here. A Puzzle and FPS hybrid, and it somehow manages to not botch it up. It's amazing to think that this game is the sequel to a game that was supposed to be a throwaway in Valve's Orange Box bundle, but instead that game became one of the most beloved PC games of all time, and even spawned a bigger and better sequel!... Though, for some reason, something feels lost in transition from Portal to Portal 2. The atmosphere, maybe? It feels less creepy, lonely, and mysterious in Portal 2... Maybe it's just my imagination. Anyways, this game is more quantity, less quality, but still good. It can be boiled down to a jumbo marshmallow that was left outside too long: fluffier, tastier, and more to it, but it feels dry, as if being left out for a time made it lose something.

Muy entretenido, solo jugue la campaña de un jugador.
Habia jugado Portal  1 y lo encontre muy bueno, este lo supera en muchos aspectos. 
Ademas de la campaña de un jugador, hay modo cooperativo y editor de escenarios.
Si te animas a comprarlo, porfavor no leas guias o veas gameplays ya que le quitaras la diversion.
El desafio esta en superarlas por uno mismo, y eso hace que este juego sea recomendable.

You aren't a real gamer if you haven't played Portal 2.
Pros:
- Well written story
- Great voice acting
- Quite enjoyable puzzles
- Quality level design
- Multiplayer, if you're into that (but singleplayer was much better)
- Good Steam Controller support because it is a Valve game
- Mute protagonist makes the game more immersive
- Good graphics (for Source)
- Combustable lemons

Cons:
- If you've taken the time to read this far, then you probably don't already have the game and you need to get it.

tl;dr:  It's not Portal 1, but it *is* Portal 2.
It got pretty boring in the middle, I'm not going to lie.  Honestly, although I was glad to learn about the history behind Aperture Science and GLaDOS, the story-mode of the game was, for me, not particularly good overall -- but it also wasn't particularly bad.  Regardless, it lacked whatever it was that Portal 1 had.
So why am I recommending it?  BECAUSE YOU CAN MAKE YOUR OWN TESTS.  And it has multiplayer.  So although the story is hit-or-miss, the rest of the game is not, and has endless replayability because anyone can make a level.  It's some pretty cool stuff.
Indispensable
Loved the strong story, puzzles and jokes. Loved the co-op. Highly reccomend it!

前作がポータルガンを使った実験的な短編ならば、
今作は内容を発展させて一般的なゲームに相当するボリュームを持たせた作品。
ポータルガン以外の特徴的なアクションが無いのに、数多くのギミックで奥深いパズル性を生み出しているのは見事。
反発・加速するジェルなどの新たな仕掛けが多数登場し、パズルの難易度も上がっている。
ストーリーも複雑になり、やけに饒舌なAIのセリフや目まぐるしく動く実験施設の演出も楽しい。
シングルプレイモードもかなりのボリュームとそれなりの難易度があるが、
より難しい協力プレイモードもある。

Portal 2 does what Portal does.  Better? maybe.  Portal is Portal, so...just do it.

With a high re-playable value thanks to the workshop and a rather easily re-playable story Portal 2 does not disappoint. Much like it's predecessors you are a silent protagonist dealing with a sinister albeit darkly amusing AI hellbent on killing you.   With a decent twist as well as rather memorable puzzles and dialogue this game is a no-brainer for puzzle lovers and just most gamers in general.

Interesting game

The orginal Portal was a brilliant game that introduced some interesting mechanics. So it was always going to be difficult for valve to follow it up with something just as good. In my opinion this  is better than the first.

Single player is brilliant and with Stephen Merchant as the voice of the robot that guides you, it is engaging and enjoyable every minute. With some great comedy throughout.

The multiplayer is also engageing and you quickly find out which of your friends are idiots when it comes to puzzles haha. Its not difficult but it does slowly go up and at points you actually have to think about what you need to do.

To get the most out of this game i would recommend doing the achievements. There are some pretty good refrences to other games etc. And it also adds more difficultly to the game.

Говорить о Portal 2 можно долго, но не признать то, что эта игра шикарна невозможно.  Вообще я редко прохожу игры до конца, но Portal 2 оказался той  редкой игрой, которую я прошла от начала и до самого конца. Все, что нужно знать об этой игре: головоломки и юмор, юмор и головоломки.  Остроумные шутеечки ГЛэДОС западают в душу и ты вроде как и смеешься и злишься. Какая же все-таки сучка эта ГЛэДОС... но да ладно. Графика приятная, музыка просто афигенная, замудренные ближе к концу головоломки , прекрасная физика и неплохой сюжет - вот что такое Portal 2, достойное продолжение первой части.В общем игра 10 космических модулей из 10.

-------------------------------------
REVIEW:
Portal 2 is a stunning puzzle/first-person/story-based/cake-eating sim. So........ heres the low down,
Portal 2 is a sequal to Valves suc·cess·ful (Heh) Portal, Portal 2 greatly expandes on what Portal did, it added a richer storyline, more characters, and new locations, it also added gels to use with your portal gun, and Co-Op mode. In this review we will go over the gameplay, storyline, pros, and lastly cons, lets get started!

1. GAMEPLAY
The gameplay of Portal 2 is extremely fun, you man the character "Chell" in different puzzle situations, all of the gameplay is first person. you have to go through different "Testing floors" avoiding lasers, turrets, laser turrets, deadly falls and deadly falling objects. In the game you use a tool called the portal gun, if you are familiar with Portal you should already know this, what it does is well obviously, it creates portals! The gun creates two different portals in two different locations, this is how you will solve the puzzles. The gameplay starts out easy, but soon progressing you will find yourself wanting to look up Youtube tutorials, I encourage you to not go to Youtube, the feeling you get when you figure out a puzzle makes up for how long it took, it makes you feel like a genius! The worst part of the gameplay for me is the fact that sometimes it feels like you are just doing a puzzle because you want to get to the storyline as soon as possible. Ultimately I think the gameplay for Portal 2 is probably 8/10.

2. STORYLINE
The storyline for Portal 2 has to be good, without a good storyline the player has no motivation to play the game, Portal2's storyline is good, its not so great, but it is good enough. The storyline is interesting but at some points it dips into things like shallow and predictable. The storyline has a very neat twist in the end that I will leave it to you to figure out. The storyline doesn't go much into the unknown past of Chell her childhood mostly remains a mystery, it focuses more on getting her out of the facililty and stopping the evil GLADYS (Her name is something like that). I think that the storyline is worth it but it could have used some work. 7/10.

3. Pros
-Great brain racking fun
-Cake!
-Free cake!
-interesting characters
-Puzzles have more than one way to solve them.
-strange drawings on the wall from ratman
-Great atmosphere! A little creepy and mysterious
-CO-OP
-Great soundtrack
And more!

4. CONS
This is an interesting subject since so many people are always giving it great reviews, I will give you the "Nitty-Gritty"
-Lack of player choice (Can not choose where to go, not open world, can't impact the storyline)
-Can get boring after a while
-Puzzles get repetitive 
-Not very much variety


ULTIMATELY I would give this game a 8/10 and I highly suggest you getting this game if you like puzzlers.
